casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Appellee, v. Edwin James DOHERTY, Appellant. No. 25851. United States Court of Appeals, Ninth Circuit May 24, 1971. Rehearing Denied Aug. 3, 1971. Martha Goldin (argued), of Saltzman & Goldin, Hollywood, Cal., for appellant. Phillip W. Johnson (argued), Asst. U. S. Atty., Harry D. Steward, U. S. Atty., San Diego, Cal., for appellee.

Before BARNES, ELY and HUFSTEDLER, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM:

Appellant’s conviction is affirmed. United States v. Markham, 440 F.2d 1119 (9th Cir. 1971); United States v. Weil, 432 F.2d 1320 (9th Cir. 1970), cert. denied, 401 U.S. 947, 91 S.Ct. 933, 28 L.Ed.2d 230 (1971).
